snippet: Two unusual crimes in Harlem and in the Bronx have left mallgoers worried.
abstract: Shopping cart hurled from the third floor of a parking deck at Gateway Center in the Bronx strikes two men, both of whom are hospitalized; witnesses say the violence stemmed from a dispute among livery drivers; shoppers at Gateway and at East River Plaza in Harlem, where a similar incident took place in October 2011, express fears that shopping cart attacks will continue unless additional security measures are taken.
lead_paragraph: Two unusual crimes in Harlem and in the Bronx have left mallgoers worried.

headline.seo: Hurled Shopping Carts at New York Malls Worry Shoppers
headline.main: Shoppers Shaken by Assaults With Carts at City’s Malls
headline.print_headline: At Malls, Shoppers Are Shaken by Assaults With Carts
